user_stories.title: Fix missing logo asset on documentation homepage
acceptance_criteria: docs/public/ directory exists
docs/public/logo.png file exists and is a valid PNG image
Running bun run docs:build completes without errors
Running bun run docs:preview and navigating to homepage shows logo image without broken image icon
Logo image is clearly visible and appropriately sized
user_stories.notes: Copy existing logo from /img/wreckit.png to docs/public/logo.png. VitePress serves files from public/ at site root, so /logo.png reference in docs/index.md:9 will resolve correctly.

user_stories.title: Update all repository URLs to point to canonical mikehostetler/wreckit repository
acceptance_criteria: docs/.vitepress/config.ts lines 24, 82, 87 use mikehostetler instead of jmanhype
docs/index.md line 17 uses mikehostetler instead of jmanhype
All markdown files in docs/api/ directory have been updated to use mikehostetler
Command grep -r 'jmanhype' docs/ returns no results
Clicking 'View on GitHub' button on homepage navigates to https://github.com/mikehostetler/wreckit
Clicking 'Edit this page on GitHub' link navigates to correct repository
user_stories.notes: Repository URL mismatch is pervasive across config files and 72 generated API docs. Use find-and-replace for quick fix in Phase 1, proper fix via Typedoc reconfiguration in Phase 2.

user_stories.title: Integrate Typedoc API documentation generation into build process
acceptance_criteria: package.json has new 'docs:api' script that runs typedoc
package.json 'docs:build' script runs 'bun run docs:api' before vitepress build
typedoc.json includes gitRevision and repository fields pointing to mikehostetler/wreckit
Running bun run docs:api generates files in docs/api/ without errors
Running bun run docs:build executes API generation then VitePress build
All generated API docs use correct repository URLs (grep verifies no jmanhype references)
user_stories.notes: Typedoc is already configured but not integrated into build. Adding it to docs:build ensures API docs are always in sync with code. Typedoc config needs repository URL to generate correct source links.

user_stories.title: Add API Documentation to site navigation
acceptance_criteria: docs/.vitepress/config.ts nav array includes 'API Documentation' link
docs/.vitepress/config.ts sidebar object includes /api/ configuration
API Documentation link appears in top navigation bar
Clicking API Documentation link navigates to /api/ section
API section has sidebar navigation with Overview, Agent Runner, Commands, Doctor, Dream, Geneticist links
All sidebar links in API section navigate to correct pages
user_stories.notes: API docs are generated but not discoverable through navigation. Adding nav link and sidebar configuration makes them accessible to users.

user_stories.title: Create favicon for documentation site
acceptance_criteria: docs/public/favicon.svg or favicon.ico file exists
Favicon file is valid and renders correctly in browser
Running bun run docs:preview shows favicon in browser tab
Favicon appears in browser tab when viewing any page on documentation site
user_stories.notes: Simple SVG favicon with 'W' logo on blue background matches Wreckit branding. Alternative is to copy existing PNG as favicon.ico if SVG creation is not desired.

user_stories.title: Improve API documentation landing page content
acceptance_criteria: docs/api/README.md has enhanced content with descriptions for each module
API landing page provides context about auto-generated documentation
API landing page includes instruction for regenerating docs (bun run docs:api)
Module descriptions are clear and helpful for users navigating API reference
user_stories.notes: Current API README is just a raw index. Adding descriptions and context makes it more useful for users seeking TypeScript API documentation.

user_stories.title: Verify end-to-end deployment pipeline works correctly
acceptance_criteria: Local build (bun run docs:build) completes successfully without errors
Local preview (bun run docs:preview) serves functional site at localhost:4173/wreckit/
All internal links work during preview (no 404s)
All external GitHub links navigate to mikehostetler/wreckit
GitHub Actions workflow runs successfully on push
GitHub Pages deployment completes without errors
Deployed site is accessible at GitHub Pages URL
Deployed site matches local preview (logo, links, content all correct)
